definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: The mother tiptoed into the room for fear that she should wake up her sleeping baby.
sentences.chinese: 母亲踮起脚尖走进房间，惟恐惊醒正在熟睡的宝宝。

sentences.english: I holdopen the door and he walks in.
sentences.chinese: 我开了门，他跟着走进来。

sentences.english: Laughing and talking, they went to the room.
sentences.chinese: 他们又说又笑地走进了房间。

sentences.english: He who does good comes to the temple gate, he who loves reaches the shrine.
sentences.chinese: 行善的人来到庙门口，兼爱的人走进大殿堂。

sentences.english: Boon walked in and quieted the engine.
sentences.chinese: 布恩走进来，关掉发动机。

sentences.english: Have you ever walked into a room after people have been fighting?
sentences.chinese: 你曾走进人们刚争吵过之后的房间吗？

sentences.english: I ----- Tom ------- ------ Miss Li's office just now.
sentences.chinese: 我刚才看到汤姆走进了李老师的办公室。

sentences.english: "An onion adventure" will lead the children into the the wonders of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《洋葱头历险记》会带领孩子走进这个奇妙的世界。

sentences.english: The men rippled farther outward, lighting lanterns and moving into the gorge.
sentences.chinese: 人们向更远的地方找去，点起了灯笼，走进了峡谷。

sentences.english: Not wishing to disturb his baby sister, he tiptoed into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他不想打扰他的小妹妹，蹑手蹑脚地走进了屋里。

sentences.english: That evening when she entered the theatre the manager had a most pleasant greeting for her.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，当她走进戏院时，经理极其和悦地招呼她。

sentences.english: The door opened and in came a woman with a baby in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 门开了，走进一位妇女，怀里抱着个孩子。

sentences.english: A man walks into a bar one night and asks for 3 drinks.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上一个男人走进一家酒吧要了三杯酒。

sentences.english: On entering the courtyard, I touched the pawn ticket again.
sentences.chinese: 又摸一摸当票才走进院去。

sentences.english: On entering the amphitheatre , new objects of wonder presented themselves.
sentences.chinese: 走进剧场，在不知道自己提出新的对象。

sentences.english: He tied up the horse and went into the inn .
sentences.chinese: 他系住马，走进了小酒店。

definition: to set foot in/to tread (in or on)/to walk into
to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
to have a taste of/to realize/to appreciate
to seek by inquiry or search/to call on/to visit
to set foot on/to step on or into
to explore a mystery/to probe the unknown
